See also: ander, Ander, änder, ånder, ænder, and -ander

Old English[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Proto-Germanic *anþeraz (“other, back, in return”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈɑnder/

Prefix[edit]

ander-

  1. Denoting reversal or something done in return.
    anderġilde (“compensation”)
